catalog_info.title: Topics at the Interface between Computer Science and Economics
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Mathematics 21b, Applied Mathematics 21b, or equivalent; Economics 1011a, or equivalent; or permission of instructor.
catalog_info.description: Interplay between computation and economics. Topics in electronic commerce, computational social choice, computational mechanism design, peer production, prediction markets and reputation systems. Readings in AI, theoretical CS, multi-agent systems, economic theory, and operations research.
